English: 

Enclosed is detailed information identifying Glitnir bankÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s biggest borrowers. Glitnir was one of the three largest banks in Iceland with operations in many European countries before becoming an early casualty of the Icelandic financial meltdown in October 2008. This data provides evidence that a handful of individuals and companies with strong connections to Glitnir's central shareholders borrowed large amounts of cash from the bank, often with insufficient underlying collateral. This data also gives detailed insight into the business dealings of many influential individuals that were at the forefront of the Icelandic business and political sectors prior to the nation's financial collapse.

Further included invoices show that Glitnir, a publicly listed company in the OMX Icelandic Stock Exchange, paid large sums towards the private expenses of its then-CEO Bjarni Armannsson as he resided in an Oslo apartment prior to the crisis.
